description: Integers n such that sigma(2n) - sigma(n) is a power of 2, where sigma is the sum of the divisors of n.
comments: If n is a squarefree product of Mersenne primes multiplied by a power of 2, then sigma(2n) - sigma(n) is a power of 2.
formula: Numbers n such that A000203(2*a(n)) - A000203(a(n)) = 2^w for some w.
author: _Labos Elemer_, May 22 2000
